name: Paul Kagame
bio: Paul Kagame is the President of Rwanda, widely recognized for his leadership in transforming Rwanda post-genocide. He is known for his efforts in rebuilding the country's economy and ensuring social stability.
achievements: Led the post-genocide recovery in Rwanda.
Initiated the Vision 2020 program to transform Rwanda's economy.

name: Abiy Ahmed Ali
bio: Abiy Ahmed Ali, Prime Minister of Ethiopia, was awarded the 2019 Nobel Peace Prize for his role in ending the Eritrean-Ethiopian conflict. His reforms aim to modernize the Ethiopian economy and society.
achievements: Initiated economic and political reforms in Ethiopia.

name: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala
bio: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala is the Director-General of the World Trade Organization and a former Nigerian finance minister. Known for her economic expertise, she is a strong advocate for global economic reform.
achievements: First female and first African Director-General of the WTO.
Led Nigeriaâ€™s economic recovery efforts as Finance Minister.

name: Cyril Ramaphosa
bio: Cyril Ramaphosa, President of South Africa, is known for his role in the anti-apartheid movement and his business acumen. He strives to address South Africa's economic and social challenges.
achievements: Implemented economic reforms to address inequality in South Africa.

name: Samia Suluhu Hassan
bio: Samia Suluhu Hassan is the first female president of Tanzania, committed to advancing gender equality and strengthening the Tanzanian economy.

name: Macky Sall
bio: Macky Sall, President of Senegal, is known for his economic reforms and efforts to stabilize the West African region.
achievements: Initiated economic development projects across Senegal.
Enhanced Senegal's infrastructure and energy sectors.

name: Ellen Johnson Sirleaf
bio: Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, Africa's first elected female head of state, led Liberia through post-war recovery and was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.
achievements: Awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for her work in promoting peace and gender equality.

name: Uhuru Kenyatta
bio: Uhuru Kenyatta, former president of Kenya, worked on significant infrastructure projects and championed regional stability initiatives.
achievements: Enhanced Kenya's infrastructure, including the Standard Gauge Railway.
Promoted regional trade and stability in East Africa.
